full_summary:
### ITT for Wedge Point Maintenance Dredging and Disposal at Sea

#### Summary
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans - Small Craft Harbours (DFO-SCH) has a requirement for Dredging and Disposal at Sea (DAS) services at Wedge Point Small Craft Harbour in Nova Scotia. The project aims to complete the work by 15 October, 2023.

#### Project Details
* The estimated cost of this procurement is between $1,000,001 and $5,000,000.
* The project description can be found below.
* This Invitation to Tender (ITT) is only open to pre-qualified firms who have qualified under the preceding Invitation to Qualify (ITQ) process.

#### Project Description
Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) requests tenderers to submit proposals for the maintenance dredging and disposal at sea at Wedge Point Small Craft Harbour in Nova Scotia. The contractor must ensure all work is completed by 15 October, 2023.

Prior to submitting a bid, it is recommended that interested parties visit the site. The site is open to the public. All enquires should be submitted to the Contracting Authority using the Messages function in SAP Ariba, no less than five (5) calendar days prior to the closing date.

The estimated cost of this procurement is between $1,000,001 to $5,000,000. Proposals should be submitted via SAP Ariba by the closing date and time.

#### Important Dates

* Tender Closing Date: 28 June 2023 14:00:00
* Amendment Date: 21 June 2023
* Publication Date: 13 June 2023
* Expected Contract Start Date: 19 May 2023

#### Contact Information
For further information regarding this ITT, please contact:
Miller, Rachel
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
rachel.miller@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
1713 Bedford Row, Halifax, N.S. B3J 1T3

#### Language of Tender
Tenderers may submit their proposal in either official language of Canada. Remarks related to language can be read below.

#### Unspsc Classification
This solicitation is categorized under *Dredging services (72141206)

#### Regions of Delivery
* Nova Scotia. Please see details below.

#### Trade Agreements
This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

#### Additional Details
